poem:
**Green Aspirations**

In the garden of politics,  
tensions twist like ivy,  
vines of ambition creeping  
through soil, once calm.

A frontrunner speaks boldly,  
his voice a bright seed,  
while joint roots delve deep,  
grounded in shared foliage.

On Tuesday,  
a new leaf will unfurl,  
hopeful, in the nation's  
complex landscape.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Green party leadership race exposes tensions as electoral ambitions grow The Green party will name its next leader on Tuesday after a fiercely fought leadership contest that has exposed tensions over tone, strategy and the party’s ambitions on the national stage. The frontrunner, Zack Polanski, has pitched himself as a bold communicator able to turn rising support into a mass movement. He is facing the joint candidates Ellie Chowns and Adrian Ramsay, two impactful Green". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
